description.zh-cn: 大赦是1954年《中华人民共和国宪法》中规定的对某一范围内的罪犯一律予以赦免的制度，自1975年宪法起被取消。
description.en: Amnesty was a system stipulated in the 1954 Constitution of the People's Republic of China for the complete pardon of a certain range of criminals, which was abolished by the 1975 Constitution.

description.en: The first constitution of the People's Republic of China, also known as the '54 Constitution'.

en: Constitution of the People's Republic of China (1975)

description.en: The second constitution of the People's Republic of China, also known as the '75 Constitution', which abolished the system of amnesty.

description.en: An important law in the early days of the People's Republic of China, which stipulated the organization and powers of the Central People's Government.

description.zh-cn: 中华人民共和国成立初期的国家最高权力机关。
description.en: The highest state power organ in the early days of the People's Republic of China.

description.en: Refers to the first plenary session of the CPPCC held in September 1949, which exercised the functions and powers of the National People's Congress and adopted the Common Program.

description.en: Served as the provisional constitution before the promulgation of the 1954 Constitution of the People's Republic of China.

description.en: The highest state power organ of the People's Republic of China.

description.en: The head of state position of the People's Republic of China.

description.en: The third constitution of the People's Republic of China, also known as the '78 Constitution', which did not stipulate the system of amnesty.

en: Constitution of the People's Republic of China (1982)

description.en: The fourth and current constitution of the People's Republic of China, also known as the '82 Constitution', which does not stipulate the system of amnesty.

relationships.source: 中华人民共和国宪法 (1954年)

description.zh-cn: 1954年《中华人民共和国宪法》规定了全国人民代表大会决定大赦、中华人民共和国主席发布大赦令的制度。
description.en: The 1954 Constitution of the People's Republic of China established the system where the National People's Congress decides on amnesty and the President of the PRC issues the amnesty decree.

relationships.source: 中华人民共和国宪法 (1975年)

description.zh-cn: 1975年《中华人民共和国宪法》取消了大赦制度。
description.en: The 1975 Constitution of the People's Republic of China abolished the system of amnesty.

relationships.source: 中华人民共和国宪法 (1978年)

description.zh-cn: 1978年《中华人民共和国宪法》未规定大赦制度。
description.en: The 1978 Constitution of the People's Republic of China did not provide for the system of amnesty.

relationships.source: 中华人民共和国宪法 (1982年)

description.zh-cn: 1982年《中华人民共和国宪法》未规定大赦制度。
description.en: The 1982 Constitution of the People's Republic of China does not provide for the system of amnesty.

relationships.source: 中华人民共和国中央人民政府组织法

description.zh-cn: 1949年《中华人民共和国中央人民政府组织法》规定中央人民政府委员会有权颁布国家的大赦令。
description.en: The 1949 Organic Law of the Central People's Government stipulated that the Central People's Government Council had the authority to issue state amnesty decrees.

description.zh-cn: 根据1949年《中华人民共和国中央人民政府组织法》，中央人民政府委员会有权颁布国家的大赦令。
description.en: According to the 1949 Organic Law of the Central People's Government, the Central People's Government Council had the authority to issue state amnesty decrees.

relationships.target: 中国人民政治协商会议共同纲领

description.zh-cn: 中国人民政治协商会议第一届全体会议制定了《中国人民政治协商会议共同纲领》。
description.en: The First Plenary Session of the Chinese People's Political Consultative Conference formulated the Common Program of the CPPCC.

relationships.source: 中国人民政治协商会议共同纲领

description.zh-cn: 中央人民政府委员会依据《共同纲领》行使其职权。
description.en: The Central People's Government Council exercised its powers and functions in accordance with the Common Program.

description.zh-cn: 根据1954年宪法，全国人民代表大会行使决定大赦的职权。
description.en: According to the 1954 Constitution, the National People's Congress exercised the power to decide on amnesty.

description.zh-cn: 根据1954年宪法，中华人民共和国主席根据全国人民代表大会的决定发布大赦令。
description.en: According to the 1954 Constitution, the President of the People's Republic of China issues amnesty decrees based on the decisions of the National People's Congress.
